results.title: Fawlty Towers. Hotel inspector. Germans. Touch of class
results.brief_description: The infamous Torquay hotel, “Fawlty Towers”, presided over by the eminently certifiable Basil Fawlty - played by John Cleese - is the setting for the following three hilarious episodes: “The Hotel Inspector”; “The Germans”; and “A Touch of Class”.

results.title: Faust
results.creator_credit: Friedrich W. Murnau, Erich Pommer and UFA
results.brief_description: Classic silent German cinema from the talented F.W.Murnau, 1926. “The portals of darkness are open and the shadows of the dead hunt over the earth..” opens the film with the prevailing theme of good versus evil as the devil Mephisto does a deal with alchemist Faust for his soul and potentially for dominion over the Earth - promising he will stop the plague that is rife throughout Faust’s village. Faust reneges on the arrangement choosing love - much to the delight of Archangel St. Michael. Based on the original story by Goethe. Great cinematography and effects give the film a dark foreboding and general creepiness that add to the dramatic impact of the work. This edition features orchestral soundtrack by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: Fatty Finn
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murphy, Brian Rosen, Finn Films, Australian Film Commission and Children's Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Film version of Australia’s comic strip, set in the years of the depression. Fatty is head of the neighbourhood nice guys and has a final confrontation with Bruiser Murphy and his gang of toughs. Stars Noni Hazlehurst and Bert Newton.

results.title: Fats
results.creator_credit: Michael Coyle and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Home Economics”.
This film stresses the correlation between heart disease and the consumption of fats and oils in the diet. Outlines ways in which the amount of fat and oil in the diet can be reduced.

results.title: Fatness, foods, fads (compilation)
results.brief_description: Fatness, foods and fads outlines the 5 food groups and examines the fallacies of diets such as the Israeli army diet, the no carbohydrate diet, the grapefruit diet and the macrobiotic diet. 2. “Energy, food and exercise” shows how to achieve a proper balance of food and exercise for particular needs. 3.”Whats cooking” highlights the health problems that abound in the unhygienic kitchen and poses solutions. Compared by Andrew Daddo.

results.title: Fathers of pop
results.creator_credit: Julian Cooper, Rodney Wilson and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: London in the 1950’s saw the beginnings of a ferment from which “the London Pop Scene” emerged in the sixties. Said to have begun with the Independent Group at the Institute of Contemporary Arts, one of its members at the time, Reyner Benham, reconstructs some of the events, attitudes and influences of the time and discusses with the survivors how it was then and how it looks now.

results.title: Fathers
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Discusses the role of the father in contemporary society. Previously the daily care of children was seen to be the mother’s responsibility, but an increasing number of fathers are now taking the primary responsibility for the care of their children. This active involvement by both parents with their children, could benefit all family members.
